title: Superconducting Diode Effect in a 2L-MoTe2 Device
description: Extensive electrical transport study of a dual-gated 2-layer MoTe2 device (#2) at cryogenic temperatures in a Bluefors dilution refrigerator. The measurements focus on characterizing the superconducting state and investigating the superconducting diode effect. The experiment involves detailed sweeps of temperature (down to 50mK), magnetic field (in-plane Hx, Hy and out-of-plane Hz), back gate voltage (Vbg), and DC bias current (Idc). Key measurements include resistance vs. temperature and field, differential resistance (dI/dV or dV/dI) vs. DC bias, and field-dependent critical currents, revealing asymmetric transport and Josephson junction-like interference patterns.

[Slide 17]
Asymmetry = V(I)+V(-I) at higher Idc
Asymetry is present at 0T. Where is the TRS breaking?
With Hx (I // H): strong but odd field dependence of Idc value, and relative asymmetric Idc difference (represented by peak width)
With Hy (I // H): Idc value, and asymmetric Idc difference is weakly Hy dependent. Critical field along Hy is probably high near 5T.
More robust diode effect seen at Hy > 0.6T. The polarity can can be switched with field direction.
Hy<0.6T, the sign of asymmetry fluctuates.

12. Field calibration
Hx= -0.9:0.2:0.9
Hy= -0.9:0.2:0.9
Linear model Poly11:
f(x,y) = p00 + p10*x + p01*y
Coefficients (with 95% confidence bounds):
p00 =    -0.00312  (-0.003551, -0.002689)
p10 =     0.02838  (0.02762, 0.02915)
p01 =     -0.0209  (-0.02167, -0.02013)
Quadratic fitting to find the minimum
 Hz_shift (Hx,Hy)
